weeklyEmail.teaser: Official email from the UT Austin Chapter of the Society of Physics Students

item.name: Message from the President
item.info:
Welcome back! We missed you! Hope your semester has gotten off to a great start, but isn't there something missing in your life? You feel it too? Oh, that's right! It's SPS! We'll, we're back and ready to go! Our first meeting is Monday and we already have several events lined up! I encourage you to take a look at the events below (or the summary in the sidebar) to find some things you'd like to participate in. If you have questions, feel free to reach out to us! Hope to see you on Monday (and for some of you, see you in class on Thursday)!
~Evan Ott, SPS President

item.name: Prospective Students Day
item.info: Prospective Students Day is coming up March 21-22 (new date!) and we need dorm floors for prospective students to sleep on. If you are willing to let someone sleep on your floor please fill out this form.

item.name: Undergraduate Lecture Series
item.info: Senior Eric Horsley has put together a student lecture series where each week an undergraduate will present a physics topic he or she finds interesting. Many talks are already scheduled, with the first being Eric's this Tuesday: "In Search of Phase Space in Quantum Mechanics." Come learn some physics! For more information, contact Eric at ehorsley171619@gmail.com.

item.name: First Meeting
item.info: Come learn about our plans for the semester, enjoy some pizza and some liquid nitrogen ice cream!

item.name: Journal Club, Machine Shop, Electronics
item.info: Mentoring is taking on a new spin this semester. There are going to be streams that encompass our successful workshops and add some new ones. We are going to have a Journal Club to introduce each other to different physics topics, the Machine Shop Workshop to build skills in making experimental apparatuses, and an Electronics Workshop to build skills in soldering and circuit design. Sign up if you are interested in participating. If you would like to help run one of the streams (especially the journal club) you can sign-up here .

item.name: Sunday Night Study Session
item.info: It's back! Our Sunday Night Study Session (SNSS) is in full swing! For those who haven't been, every week we invite any and all physics majors and people in physics or math classes to come by to work on homework. With many upper-division students in attendance (and some LAs for classes), when you run into problems, you won't be stuck for long. We also provide cookies, coffee, tea, etc., to help keep you <s>caffeinated</s> energized. Some come by to help or be helped! If you're interested in tutoring, making known that you're available during the night (name on a chalkboard) is a great way to earn service hours for Sigma Pi Sigma.

item.name: Physics Idol (Undergrad Research Competition)
item.info: Don't forget to reserve your slot in the new Undergraduate Research Presentation Competition during meetings this semester! Winners will be judged by a combination of a panel and popular vote, on factors covering aspects of both the research itself and its presentation. Prizes will include a custom t-shirt and a selection of prizes, not to mention bragging rights and a nice bullet-point on the resume! Sign up here.

item.name: Cooking with Physicists
item.info: Our first social event of the semester will be a potluck/cookout of sorts at the apartment of the president and vice-president! We'll have cooking appliances set up to have everyone bring some ingredients to make something delicious! Help coordinate ingredients on the Facebook event here! More info to come!

item.name: T-shirt Distribution
item.info: We are still distributing t-shirts and polos from last semester. We could really use your help to staff the booth on the fourth floor. Please sign-up here when you are available.

item.name: Valentines' Day Cards
item.info: We're bringing back physics Valentines' cards this semester! Look for us to pick up a special gift for that special someone or maybe ensnare that secret crush of yours with the likeness of Tesla or Feynman and some physics-related jokes.

item.name: Undergraduate Women in Physics
item.info: UT Undergraduate Women in Physics is founded on the principle of promoting equality in the sciences, especially physics, both at UT and in the general community. We welcome all people interested in furthering that goal! Join their UTList or Facebook group.

item.name: Comments or Questions
item.info: Have something to complain about? Or a question? Maybe an idea for a meeting or event? Or suggestions about how we use technology? Contact us at spsofficers@gmail.com or see the links below! As always, Don't Forget To Be Awesome!
